1.title: Gamblers and Legends
1.plot: Linda Greenlaw and Captain Scotty renew their friendly rivalry and Captain Slick suffers with a clumsy greenhorn crew while Chomps takes whatever crew he can get at the last minute. All four captains and ships set out for the Grand Banks to catch swords.

2.title: Long Lines and Short Tempers
2.plot: With a storm barreling toward the fishing grounds, every captain is racing to put fish on the boat before they're forced to shore. On the Frances Anne, deck boss Lemmy makes an epic mistake that inspires Captain Slick's first meltdown of the season.

3.title: The Storm of the Century
3.plot: The biggest hurricane system since the "Perfect Storm" unleashes its fury across the North Atlantic and the four captains have to decide whether to ride it out or come back to shore. Chompers and Scotty head into dock but find the storm has followed them.

4.title: With Friends Like These
4.plot: Linda's decision to ride out Hurricane Igor on the fishing grounds has left her in a prime spot, alone on the Grand Banks. Now, Captains Scotty and Chompers will have to come up with a new plan to make up for lost time while they braved the storm inland.

5.title: Charlie Foxtrot
5.plot: Halfway through one of the worst fishing seasons in memory, every crew is put to the test. The Frances Anne offloads a decent trip but deck boss Lemmy suffers a season ending injury and tempers flare on the Hannah Boden between slacking crew members.

6.title: Foreign Relations
6.plot: A Japanese boat enters the Grand Banks and nabs the top fishing spot from the fleet. Captain Greenlaw helps out Scotty and the Eagle Eye 2 calls it quits on the Grand Banks and heads south. Then Slick's autopilot breaks and Butters takes the wheel.

7.title: Bested, Battered, and Broke
7.plot: The Eagle Eye 2 offloads enough to cover their expenses and heads south to George's Bank and Linda's decision to stay on the Grand Banks comes back to haunt her. And, plagued with auto pilot issues, the Frances Anne is forced to steam back to port.

8.title: Dead in the Water
8.plot: Linda's crew questions her ability after their bad luck on the Grand Banks. Scotty's decision to head for George's Bank starts to payoff bigtime. Captain Slick is on the fish but a greenhorn makes a mistake that costs them time and fish.

9.title: Lost Hopes and Last Chances
9.plot: Near the end of the season, the Hannah Boden finally reaches George's Bank where Linda looks to Scotty for help in finding the fish. The Frances Anne hides in a remote fishing area away from the rest of the fleet, and Chompers has his worst season ever.

10.title: The Final Gamble
10.plot: It's the homestretch of the 2010 swordfishing season and all four boats and their crews have suffered at Mother Nature's hand. Everyone keeps their fingers crossed for the results of the last offload and hopes for a paycheck.

1.title: Voyage to Hell
1.plot: The Fall sword fishing season gets off to a rocky start after engine failure aboard the Sea Hawk sends the Eagle Eye II on a mission of mercy. Then a little coastal boat takes a big risk on the dangerous waters of the Grand Banks.

2.title: Blood on the Deck
2.plot: An accident plagues the Eagle Eye II and leaves the crew a man down while the Sea Hawk and Big Eye battle big seas to get the swords on deck. Also, the Frances Anne sets out with a young greenhorn surfer that has never been on a fishing boat before.

3.title: Hostile Takeover
3.plot: The Eagle Eye II hits a patch of deadly blue sharks and the Sea Hawk and the Big Eye get their lines crossed as they battle for territory. Then, an injury aboard the Frances Anne could cost the crew thousands of dollars in lost wages.

4.title: Man Overboard
4.plot: Stormy seas beat up the Eagle Eye II as tempers flare aboard the Big Eye. The Frances Anne scrambles to find another crewman when they lose their greenhorn and a rogue wave nearly sends a man overboard on the Sea Hawk.

5.title: Home Sick
5.plot: Chomper's temper threatens to incite a mutiny on the Big Eye and sharks take a bite out of the Frances Anne's catch. Also, Linda is left high and dry as a crew member quits and cabin fever strikes the Eagle Eye II after five weeks at sea.

6.title: Making Waves
6.plot: The Big Eye starts a turf war to fill their hold with fish as the Eagle Eye II battles rough seas and broken gear. Aboard the Sea Hawk, a faulty electrical line puts a man down and a 30-foot rogue wave hits the Frances Anne in the dead of night.

7.title: A Perfect Storm
7.plot: As the weather turns bad, the Big Eye takes a chance and sets out as a storm approaches while the Eagle Eye II battles fatigue, rogue waves and sharks.

8.title: Pay Out
8.plot: As the Sword season comes to end, the Big Eye gambles on one last set. A disappointing off load for the Sea Hawk ends their cursed season and the Eagle Eye II gets pushed to the limit in a race to fill their hold with swords.

1.title: Grand Banks or Bust
1.plot: Season 2 begins with Capt. Scotty crowded out of his favorite fishing spot and legendary Capt. Linda vowing to find fish this year or retire for good. His deckhand brother's medical bills puts Capt. Chomps in the red before they can even leave the dock.

2.title: Deckhands Down
2.plot: Capt. "Slick" and his young guns join the fishing grounds. Capt. Linda's crew is dropping like flies after bad luck and injuries. Blue sharks are Capt. Scotty's bane but sharktagger Lisa's boon. Chomps questions his decision to come to the Grand Banks.

3.title: Turf War
3.plot: The Frances Anne's gear is all "sharked up", and a deckhand's mistake almost costs them the fish they already have in the hold. Eagle Eye 2 is defending its turf when deckhand Fox is knocked to the deck. Capt. Chomps clashes with another captain.

4.title: Overloaded and Into the Storm
4.plot: Fish holds are filled or filling fast. The Big Eye survives the storm, but more than just fish leave Capt. Chomp's boat when they reach port. Capt. Slick forgives and forgets Lemy's mistake when their new problem becomes finding more space to stuff fish.

5.title: So Close But So Far
5.plot: Capt. Linda rides out the storm in port, while Capt. Scotty debates high prices vs. hurricane-force winds to decide whether docking is just too dangerous. Out at sea, the storm is fouling gear and tempers.

6.title: Man Overboard!
6.plot: On the second trip, fishing is poorer and weather is no better. The Big Eye heads south to safer waters, but the job is still as dangerous -- as greenhorn Don finds out when he goes overboard into sharky waters.

7.title: Needle and Thread to the Head
7.plot: Boat and crew member frustrations stymie the Bjorn 2. Greenhorn Don decides to take sewing up his head wound into his own hands, literally. Stress causes Capt. Slick to blow his stack. Later, he's demoted when the boat owner decides to take over the helm.

8.title: Trapped
8.plot: Capt. Scotty's gable doesn't pay off. His gear becomes tangled in traps, the line snapping and whipping deckhand Brian. Capt. Chomps' luck is looking up until a line fouls the Big Eye's propeller. It's dead in the water, and Hurricane Ida is approaching.

9.title: What Happened on the Back Deck?
9.plot: Supplies are low, fish few, and luck bad. The Bjorn 2 must fish short-handed when Deckhand Dave goes overboard and Capt. Linda is forced from the deck when her hand accidentally gets caught in the hauling block.

10.title: What It Takes to Be a Fisherman
10.plot: The crews hope for big fish and big money on their final haulbacks of the season. Back in port, the Bjorn 2 deals with their medical emergencies; Chomps deals with crew jumping ship; and a demoted Slick wonders if he will return to the captain's chair.

imdb.plot outline: Swords season 2 centers the high-risk world of New England's long line fishermen. These men and women are gamblers, risking all to catch an elusive prey in some of the most dangerous waters on the planet. They are uniformly tough and resilient, and they need to be because every day could be their last.
imdb.title: Swords
plot: _Swords_ (qv) season 2 centers the high-risk world of New England's long line fishermen. These men and women are gamblers, risking all to catch an elusive prey in some of the most dangerous waters on the planet. They are uniformly tough and resilient, and they need to be because every day could be their last.
